resources.string: Enter the user you wish to chat with

You currently do not have an account associated with this device.\n\nThe next few screens will allow you to create an RSA public/private key, and to set up a new account or connect this device to an existing account.
Please select a password.\n\nThis passcode will be used to encrypt the data on your device. There is no way to recover this passcode; if you lose it the data in this application will be lost.

Now, please select an RSA key size. The smaller the key, the faster the encryption, but the less secure mssages will be. A 1024 bit key may take several seconds to generate, a 2048 key can take a few minutes, and a 4096 key several minutes to generate. This is done only once.
Now you need to enter a SecureChat server URL. This is the Java Tomcat server that was set up to chat between clients.
Select a username and password. This will be used to identify you to other people.\n\nFor the best security, select a username which is not related to your e-mail address or your personal name....
Enter your username/password pair. If you have forgotten your password, you can reset it using another device associated with your account.

Enter the username of the account whose password you wish to reset.\n\nThis will send a message to your other attached devices giving you the chance to reset your password. You may then log in using this device to add it to your account.
Your device is now set up and connected to your account.
Please supply your username and password for your server account.
The passcode you entered is incorrect.
This will erase the old RSA key, reset the username on this device, and cause all stored messages to be erased.

By disconnecting this device from your account, you will lose all messages on this device and you will no longer receive messages from the remote server.

 Because messages are not stored on the remote server, lost messages may not be recovered.

This operation cannot be undone.
This device has been disconnected from your account, and all messages have been erased from this device. RSA tokens have been cleared, and you will now be asked to set up a new account.
Please select a new device passcode. This passcode is used when opening up the application.
Your application passcode has been reset.
Please select a new password. Your existing server account\'s password will be replaced with this new password.
The new passcode must match the retyped passcode.
The new password must match the retyped passcode.
When you set up a new account, the contents of this device, the old private key, and other account information will be erased.
This will erase the old RSA key, reset the username on this device, and cause all stored messages to be erased.
The passcode you selected is too short. It needs to be at least 4 digits.
Your password must be at least 8 characters, with a capital and lowercase letter, number and punctuation.
Your password has been reset. Please check on another device on your account for steps to reset your password.
An unexpected problem was reported by the remote server
The username or password provided are incorrect.
An unexpected problem was reported by the remote server.
You are currently not authorized to perform this operation.
The username you selected is already taken; please pick another.
Unable to find this device in the server
The user you provided is unknown. Please check and try again.
An unknown server error was reported.
Your RSA Key has been generated.

Are you sure you wish to regenerate your RSA key? Doing so will make it impossible to read stored messages, and should only be done if you suspect your private key on this device has been compromised.
The larger the RSA key, the longer this will take. A long RSA key can take over a minute to generate, and cannot be canceled. This operation only needs to be done once. Continue?
Please enter the URL of a sever that is hosting the SecureChat server URL.
The server you provided is unavailable or incorrect.
Now select a user account. If you have an account you can associate this device to that account. You can also create a new account.
